title: Mobile-Based COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy Analysis Modeling and Language Expression Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics and understanding of infectious disease transmission models (SIR), foundational Python programming, and basic writing skills for data analysis reports along with academic vocabulary proficiency
context.additional_context: This module focuses on analyzing the epidemiological impact of vaccines through data-driven modeling practice in a smartphone-based microlearning environment and expressing the findings in structured academic language (text/visualization). Special emphasis is placed on academic expression clarity, logical organization, and proper use of technical terminology to convey scientific analysis results.

learning_goals: The impact of vaccination rates on infection curves can be simulated using a modified SIR model and explained through a linguistic framework that compares and contrasts analytical results

Learners will build a vaccine efficacy prediction framework using country-specific vaccination data (minimum 3 countries) and a machine learning model (Random Forest or XGBoost) within one week, achieve over 75% accuracy or F1-score on test datasets, and present findings through structured academic reports and visualizations (using Matplotlib or Seaborn)

Learners will interpret vaccine impact analysis results using Python-based data visualization tools (e.g., Plotly) in mobile environments and enhance linguistic proficiency to articulate findings with logical coherence and precise vocabulary in both academic and practical contexts

resources: Mobile app compatible with Google Colab
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
